meanings.definition: To transfer or adapt software to run on a different platform.
meanings.sent1: I am porting my favorite game to my new phone.
meanings.sent2: Developers often need to port applications to work on various devices.
meanings.sent3: The software engineer joked about porting the code to a toaster.
meanings.sent4: She skillfully ported the program to the virtual reality environment.
meanings.sent5: Porting the software felt like solving a challenging puzzle.

meanings.definition: The act of carrying or transporting something from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: The porting of goods from the warehouse to the store was efficient.
meanings.sent2: Porting heavy boxes can be tiring for the workers.
meanings.sent3: The porting of the treasure chest made the pirates smile.
meanings.sent4: The porting of the fragile vase required extra care.
meanings.sent5: The porting of the luggage was done with precision and speed.
